45
In a case where a descendant or an adoptive child who has a right to a statutory portion is heavily in debt or over-profligate, the testator may dispossess him or her of the whole or a part of the statutory portion for the benefit of the forced heir's descendants. Such a dispossession shall remain valid only when the heir dispossessed of his or her statutory portion has, at the time of inheriting, an underage child or a grandchild by a previously deceased child, or if he or she has a child of full age or a grandchild of full age by a previously deceased child, and this child or grandchild has no earning capacity.
